page.title: 02LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: Camus (a Dane) one of the Swein's best generals, was sent to attack Scotland in 1010.He landed his troops in the vicinity of Red Head, a few miles from Arbroath.Proceeding to Brechin he set fire to the church and town.Coming south he burned Panbride and Arbirlot.Camping on the site of Carnoustie he waited for King Malcolm II of Scotland who was marching with his army from Dundee.Malcolm stopped at Barry and set up his position in front of and about a mile from his attackers.Both armies prepared for battle.The battle was long,but in the end the Danish were deafeated.Camus was killed on the Heights of Monikie where a stone cross still points out the spot where he died.
